region_description: Marrakech, known as the 'Red City' due to its distinct red sandstone buildings, is a vibrant destination that combines rich history, stunning architecture, and a bustling atmosphere. The city is famous for its medina, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where visitors can explore narrow alleyways filled with markets, artisans, and local cuisine. Marrakech is also home to beautiful palaces, gardens, and mosques, showcasing the country's Islamic architecture and culture. The city's lively souks and the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square, filled with street performers and food stalls, make it an unforgettable experience for travelers.

places_to_visit.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa
places_to_visit.description: Jemaa el-Fnaa is the main square in Marrakech and a UNESCO Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. The square comes alive with street performers, food vendors, and markets, providing a unique cultural experience.

places_to_visit.name: Koutoubia Mosque
places_to_visit.description: Koutoubia Mosque is the largest mosque in Marrakech and an iconic symbol of the city. Its stunning minaret, visible from various parts of the city, showcases exquisite Moorish architecture and intricate tile work.

places_to_visit.name: Majorelle Garden
places_to_visit.description: Majorelle Garden is a beautiful botanical garden created by French painter Jacques Majorelle. The garden features exotic plants, vibrant colors, and the famous blue villa, which now houses the Yves Saint Laurent Museum.

places_to_visit.name: Bahia Palace
places_to_visit.description: Bahia Palace is a stunning example of Moroccan architecture, known for its intricate tile work and lush gardens. The palace was built in the late 19th century and served as the residence of a grand vizier.

hotels.name: La Mamounia
hotels.description: La Mamounia is a luxury hotel renowned for its opulent design and stunning gardens. With world-class amenities, fine dining, and a lavish spa, it offers a perfect escape in the heart of Marrakech.

hotels.name: Riad Kniza
hotels.description: Riad Kniza is a charming boutique hotel located in the medina. It offers authentic Moroccan hospitality, comfortable accommodations, and a peaceful atmosphere, providing a unique cultural experience.

restaurants.name: Le Tobsil
restaurants.description: Le Tobsil is a renowned restaurant serving traditional Moroccan cuisine in a beautiful riad setting. Guests can enjoy a multi-course meal while experiencing the warm ambiance of Moroccan hospitality.

restaurants.name: Al Fassia
restaurants.description: Al Fassia is famous for its authentic Moroccan dishes, especially the lamb tagine and couscous. The restaurant is run by women and offers a unique dining experience with a local touch.
